fields.summary: Compactor doesn't pass Table properties to the Orc writer

fields.description:
According to the doc:
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/LanguageManual+ORC#LanguageManualORC-HiveQLSyntax
One should be able to specify tblproperties for many ORC options.

But the settings for orc.compress.size and orc.stripe.size don't take effect.
fields.summary: Hive Streaming does not honor orc.compress.size and orc.stripe.size table properties

comments.body: [~prasanth_j] [~owen.omalley] Can you please review?

256KB is the default buffer size for base which will make 64KB for delta files which I think is huge when multiple delta files are open. Either we have to scale down the default buffer size to 64KB or change the ratio so that delta files gets 16KB which was previous default.
I would prefer scaling down the default 256KB buffer size to 64KB. [~owen.omalley] Thoughts?

ATTACHMENT ID: 12800332 - PreCommit-HIVE-MASTER-Build

Actually, let's split the difference. I'd propose:

default ratio: 8
default compression chunk: 128k
default stripe size: 64MB

delta compression: 16k
delta stripe: 8MB

thoughts?

IMO, we are often hit by OOM because of compression buffer size and not stripe size. 

How about this?

default ratio: 4

*Base files:*
default compression chunk: 64k
default stripe size: 64MB

*Delta files:*
delta compression: 16k
delta stripe: 16MB

I think the ratio is better at 8 since we have the minor compaction set to run when there are 10 deltas, so 8 is a better match to the increase in work load.

How about:

ratio: 8
base compression 128k stripe 128mb
delta compression 16k stripe 16mb
[~wzheng], will this go into 2.1.0? Thanks
[~jcamachorodriguez] Yes this is going in

[~owen.omalley] I don't understand how the ratio is related to triggering of minor compaction. 
With increase in stripe size to 128MB we are going to get less parallelism which may lead to jobs running slow.

Removing 2.1.0 target as issue is not tagged as Critical/Blocker and the RC will be created tomorrow. Please feel free to commit to branch-2.1 anyway and fix for 2.1.0 if this happens before the release.
Patch 2. [~prasanth_j] Can you take a look?
patch 3 addressed review comment
